function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Changes in energy consumption patterns could lead to increased risk of indoor air pollution and respiratory diseases due to higher usage of household appliances.","Impact":"Higher risk of respiratory diseases and indoor air pollution if energy consumption patterns are not managed effectively.","Mitigation":"Proper ventilation systems, regular cleaning of household appliances, and awareness programs to promote energy-saving practices.","Technologies":"Smart energy management systems, air purifiers, and IoT-enabled ventilation systems.","People":"Households, especially those with poor ventilation and air quality management.","Owner":"Local authorities, health organizations, and energy management companies."},{"Description":"Increased use of domestic hot water systems and household appliances can lead to a higher demand for water and energy, putting a strain on resources and increasing the risk of utility shortages.","Impact":"Potential shortages of water and energy resources leading to service disruptions and higher costs.","Mitigation":"Promotion of water and energy-efficient appliances, implementation of water and energy conservation programs, and investment in sustainable energy sources.","Technologies":"Water-efficient appliances, smart water meters, and renewable energy technologies.","People":"Communities and regions with limited water and energy resources.","Owner":"Government agencies, utility providers, and environmental organizations."}]}
